page.title: 03N.Duffield Primary Schools
page.content: The old school only had two classrooms, so one class had to work in the village hall, which was about 200 yards away. We had to move into a new school because there was not enough room in the old one for every one to fit in and apart from that it was very damp and the walls were rotting. In the winter it was very cold in the village hall, so that sometimes we had to keep our coats on all day. The new school opened in October 1984. There are three classes working in large,bright,colourful classes. There are four teachers and a secretary. There is a very large hall with a music area and P.E. equipment. Pupils transfer at the age of eleven to the nearby Comprehensive School at Barlby.There is a play group for under fives supervised by parents in the Village Hall.
